meanings.definition: Of or relating to the ear.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used an auricular thermometer to check my temperature.
meanings.sent2: The auricular canal is a part of the ear that helps in hearing.
meanings.sent3: I found an auricular-shaped cloud in the sky today!
meanings.sent4: The auricular resemblance between the twins was striking.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the waves crashing against the shore was an auricular delight.

meanings.definition: Spoken or heard by the ear.
meanings.sent1: The auricular instructions were clear and easy to follow.
meanings.sent2: She whispered an auricular message to her friend during the class.
meanings.sent3: The auricular rumor about the new student spread quickly.
meanings.sent4: His auricular memory was sharp, recalling every word she said.
meanings.sent5: The auricular feedback from the audience was positive and encouraging.

meanings.sent1: The priest listened attentively during the auricular.
meanings.sent2: She felt relieved after her auricular with the priest.
meanings.sent3: The auricular brought a sense of peace to her troubled mind.
meanings.sent4: His auricular revealed deep emotions he had kept hidden.
meanings.sent5: The auricular provided a cathartic release for her inner thoughts.
